In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can solve this problem using Julia programming language:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map((dt)->Dates.format(dt, "yyyymm"), df[:dt])
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame as input and adds a new column `ym` to it. The values in this new column are the year and month of each DateTime value from the original column `dt`. 

The `map` function applies a function (in this case, extracting the year and month from a DateTime) to every element in an array (in this case, every row in the DataFrame). The `Dates.format` function formats a DateTime as a string with the specified format.
